alert.note: Alert for Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:21PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL VALENCIA AND NORTH CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Bernardo to near San Acacia to near Socorro. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Socorro, San Antonio, Veguita, San Acacia, Jarales, Casa Colorada, Bernardo, La Joya, Escondida and Sabinal. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 139 and 153, and between Mile Markers 163 and 189. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 135 and 179. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; West Central Highlands
